t: Hear*p the right, O Lord,*s attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
Let*p my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
Thou*p hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
Concerning*p the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.
Hold*p up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
I*p have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Shew*p thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.
Keep*p me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
From*p the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.
They*p are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
They*p have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
Like*p as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
Arise,*p O Lord,*s disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

From*p men which are thy hand, O Lord,*s from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
As*p for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
